Include any equations in your answer

Explain why the wood floats

The see-saw is balanced horizontally
Calculate the weight \(W\) of the brother
A girl and her brother sit on opposite sides of a see-saw as shown in Fig. 3.1
The weight of the girl in Fig. 3.1 is \(240 \text{N}\)

mass of girl =   .........  unit
State the form of the energy stored in the fuel
Some of the energy stored in the fuel is not converted to electrical energy
Suggest how energy is wasted in the generator
A power station burns fossil fuel to produce electrical energy
Solar panels produce electrical energy
State two advantages and two disadvantages of using solar panels, rather than fossil fuels, to produce electrical energy
advantages
disadvantages
Fig. 5.1 shows a tractor and a car of the same weight
The vehicles drive over the same soft ground
Explain why the car sinks into the soft ground but the tractor does **not** sink
The car driver measures the pressure of the air in a car tyre when the air is cool
The Sun heats the air in the tyre. The driver measures the pressure of the air in the tyre when the air is warm
The pressure of the air in the warm tyre is greater
Explain the increase in the pressure of the air in the tyre. Use ideas about air molecules
State the process of thermal energy transfer through the rods
Explain how the arrangement in Fig. 6.1 can show which rod transfers thermal energy the most quickly
Three rods are identical in size and shape, but each rod is made from a different material. On one end of each rod is a pin held in place by wax. The wax melts when it is warm
The rods are placed on a block of wood and heated equally by a Bunsen burner as shown in Fig. 6.1
State the process by which infrared waves transfer thermal energy
State the process of thermal energy transfer which does not require a medium
Fig. 6.2 shows a heater for warming a room. When there is hot water in the heater, the thermal energy of the water transfers to the room
The shiny foil on the wall increases the efficiency of the heater
Explain how the shiny foil increases the efficiency of the heater
State the name of a region of the electromagnetic spectrum which has **longer** wavelengths than visible light
State the name of a region of the electromagnetic spectrum which has **shorter** wavelengths than visible light
Electromagnetic waves are travelling through a vacuum. Indicate the property that is always the same for all the waves
Tick \((\checkmark)\) one box
Indicate the correct statement about the nature of electromagnetic waves
Tick \((\checkmark)\) one box

table.html:
All electromagnetic waves are transverse.
All electromagnetic waves are longitudinal.
Some electromagnetic waves are transverse and some are longitudinal.

content.text: Indicate the correct statement about the action of electromagnetic waves
Tick \((\checkmark)\) one box

table.html:
They transfer energy from one place to another.
They transfer atoms from one place to another.
They transfer molecules from one place to another.
